{{Location Intro|description=<p>Prior to {{Quest|The Temple Where Sand Flows Like Tears}}, the subarea is named '''The Temples Forsaken'''. During this quest, the name is changed and the sand is cleared.</p>}}

In the [[Tanit]] tribe, the canyon is referred to as "the Great Rift."<ref>{{Ref/Quest|The Temple Where Sand Flows Like Tears}}</ref>

==Descriptions==
{{Description|The ruins of the temple of Gurabad. The desert songs say that long-lived giants once dwelled here.<br />But they were cast down into a rift in the earth within a single night, never to be seen again...<br />and so did the great temple also become some ruins in a valley rift.|Viewpoint, [[Viewpoint/The Palace Abandoned by the Gods|The Palace Abandoned by the Gods]]}}
{{Description|To the desert tribes, this abandoned, ruined square goes by the name "Safhe Shatranj."<br />Researchers believe that this was once a "training field" for ancient war machines.|Viewpoint, [[Viewpoint/Safhe Shatranj|Safhe Shatranj]]}}

==Trivia==
===Etymology===
* {{Lang|''Safhe {{w|Shatranj}}''|fa=صفحه شطرنج}} is Persian for chessboard.
